title: CatalogSearchParams
content:
This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.
To submit a bug report on the content, see
https://devforum.roblox.com/c/bug-reports/documentation-issues/72

name: CatalogSearchParams
type: datatype
summary: |
  Stores parameters used in catalog searches via
  Class.AvatarEditorService:SearchCatalogAsync().
description: |
  The Datatype.CatalogSearchParams data type stores the parameters of a
  catalog search via Class.AvatarEditorService:SearchCatalogAsync().

  When accessing the value of the Datatype.CatalogSearchParams.BundleTypes or
  Datatype.CatalogSearchParams.AssetTypes property the returned table will be
  read-only to avoid confusion when not directly accessing the
  Datatype.CatalogSearchParams instance.

  For example, you can use these properties as follows:

  lua
  local params = CatalogSearchParams.new()
  params.SearchKeyword = "Test"
  params.MinPrice = 5000
  params.MaxPrice = 10000
  params.BundleTypes = {Enum.BundleType.Animations, Enum.BundleType.BodyParts}

  local types = params.BundleTypes
  for , val in types do
    print(val)
  end
  -- table.insert(types, Enum.BundleType.Animations) -- This would not work because the table is read only

codesamples: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
constructors: []
constants: []
properties:
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.SearchKeyword
    type: string
    summary: |
      The keyword to search for catalog results with.
    description: |
      The keyword to search for catalog results with.
    default: ''
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.MinPrice
    type: number
    summary: |
      The minimum item price to search for.
    description: |
      The minimum item price to search for.
    default: 0
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.MaxPrice
    type: number
    summary: |
      The maximum item price to search for.
    description: |
      The maximum item price to search for.
    default: 2147483647
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.SortType
    type: CatalogSortType
    summary: |
      The order in which to sort the results.
    description: |
      The order in which to sort the results, represented by a
      Enum.CatalogSortType.
    default: Enum.CatalogSortType.Relevance
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.SortAggregation
    type: Enum.CatalogSortAggregation
    summary: |
      The time period to use to aggregate the sort results.
    description: |
      The time period to use to aggregate the sort results by, represented by a
      Enum.CatalogCategoryFilter. This only applies when the sort type is
      Enum.CatalogSortType.MostFavorited or
      Enum.CatalogSortType.BestSelling. It does not apply for other sort
      types.
    default: Enum.CatalogSortAggregation.AllTime
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.CategoryFilter
    type: CatalogCategoryFilter
    summary: |
      The category to filter the search by.
    description: |
      The category to filter the search by, represented by a
      Enum.CatalogCategoryFilter.
    default: Enum.CatalogCategoryFilter.None
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.SalesTypeFilter
    type: Enum.SalesTypeFilter
    summary: |
      The sales type filter the search by.
    description: |
      The sales type the search by, represented by a Enum.SalesTypeFilter.
    default: Enum.SalesTypeFilter.All
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.BundleTypes
    type: Array
    summary: |
      An array containing Enum.BundleType values to filter the search by.
    description: |
      An array containing Enum.BundleType values to filter the search by.
    default: '{}'
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.AssetTypes
    type: Array
    summary: |
      An array containing Enum.AvatarAssetType values to filter the search by.
    description: |
      An array containing Enum.AvatarAssetType values to filter the search by.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.IncludeOffSale
    type: bool
    summary: |
      Whether off sale items should be included in the results.
    description: |
      Whether off sale items should be included in the results.
    default: false
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.CreatorName
    type: string
    summary: |
      Search for items with the given creator name.
    description: |
      Search for items with the given creator name. Specify whether to search
      users, groups, or both with Datatype.CatalogSearchParams.CreatorType.
    default: ''
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.CreatorType
    type: Enum.CreatorTypeFilter
    summary: |
      Search for items created by the given creator type.
    description: |
      Search for items created by the given creator type. When unspecified, it
      defaults to returning creations from both Enum.CreatorTypeFilter.User
      and Enum.CreatorTypeFilter.Group. Searching by
      Datatype.CatalogSearchParams.CreatorId with Enum.CreatorTypeFilter.All
      results in a HTTP 400 Bad Request error.
    default: Enum.CreatorTypeFilter.All
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.CreatorId
    type: number
    summary: |
      Search for items created by the given creator ID.
    description: |
      Search for items created by the single creator ID. Specify user or group
      with Datatype.CatalogSearchParams.CreatorType. Searching by creator ID
      and creator name is not supported; specify one, not both.
    default: 0
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
  - name: CatalogSearchParams.Limit
    type: number
    summary: |
      Specifies the number of items to return. Accepts 10, 28, 30, 60,
      and 120. Defaults to 30.
    description: |
      Specifies the number of items to return. Accepts 10, 28, 30, 60,
      and 120. Defaults to 30.
    default:
    codesamples: []
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
methods: []
functions: []
